content: यात्रा [या-ष्ट्रन्] {@--1@} Going, motion, journey; <ls>Mv. 6. 1</ls>; <ls>R. 18. 16.</ls> {@--2@} The march of an army, expedition, invasion; मार्गशीर्षे शुभे मासि यायाद्यात्रां महीपतिः <ls>Ms. 7. 182</ls>; <ls>Pt. 3. 37</ls>; <ls>R. 17. 56.</ls> {@--3@} Going on a pilgrimage; as in तीर्थयात्रा. {@--4@} A company of pilgrims. {@--5@} A festival, fair, festive or solemn occasion; कालप्रियनाथस्य यात्राप्रसंगेन <ls>Māl. 1</ls>; <ls>U. 1.</ls> {@--6@} A procession, festive train; प्रवृत्ता खलु यात्राभिमुखं मालती <ls>Māl. 6</ls>; <ls n="Māl.">6. 2.</ls> {@--7@} A road. {@--8@} Support of life, livelihood, maintenance; यात्रामात्रप्रसिद्ध्यर्थं <ls>Ms. 4. 3</ls>; शरीरयात्रापि च ते न प्रसिध्येदकर्मणः <ls>Bg. 3. 8.</ls> {@--9@} Passing away (time). {@--10@} Intercourse; यात्रा चैव हि लौकिकी <ls>Ms. 11. 185</ls>; लोकयात्रा <ls>Ve. 3</ls>; <ls>Ms. 9. 27.</ls> {@--11@} Way, means, expedient. {@--12@} A custom, usage, practice, way; एषोदिता लोकयात्रा नित्यं स्त्रीपुंसयोः परा <ls>Ms. 9. 25.</ls> (लोकाचारः <ls>Kull.</ls>). {@--13@} A vehicle in general. {@--14@} A kind of dramatic entertainment.
